description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). 21 to 22 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. Collation on the margin. Catchword on the verso of each leaf. Indication of the abbreviations (rumūz) used in the text on fol. 1a. Mention of the dates of birth and death of the author (849-911) on fol. 298a. Worm eaten. Particularly fragile. Copy completed by Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd Allāh al-Ḥusaynī al-Armayūnī, the author's pupil ("tilmīdh al-muʼallif") on 5 Jumādá al-Ākhirah 913 [October 12, 1507] (colophon, fol. 298a). Incipit: هذا ذيل على كتابى المسمى بالجامع الصغير من حديث البشير النذير سميته زيادة الجامع ورموزه كرموزه والترتيب كالترتيب وما توفيقى الا بالله ... حرف الهمزة اتى يوم القيامة باب الجنة فيفتح لي فاري ربي Explicit: اليسر يمن والعسر شوم فر عن رجل اخر الكتاب
author: Suyūṭī
abstract: Collection of ḥadīth, a supplement to al-Jāmiʻ al-ṣaghīr by the author.
extent: 259 leaves: paper ; 220 x 157 (156 x 109) mm. bound to 220 x 173 mm.
provenance: Two ownership statements on fol. 1a, one signed Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Marḥwān(?), dated 1 Rabīʻ al-Thānī 1020 [June 13, 1611], the other signed ʻUmar, dated 27 Rabīʻ al-Thānī 1339 [January 8, 1921]. Ownership statement on fol. 298b, signed Muḥammad Ibn Maḥmūd Karīm Khwājah, dated Jumādá al-Awwal 1259 or 1359 [1843 or 1940]. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
creator: Suyūṭī
سيوطي
subject: Hadith—Texts—Early works to 1800
binding_note: Golden brown leather over paper pasteboards for upper and lower covers, fore-edge flap and envelope flap. Both covers are similarly blind-tooled with a central mandorla and an outer frame consisting of single fillets surrounding a s-shape running pattern. The envelope flap has a similar outer frame with a circular stamp on its point.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
